job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Mobile, AL
pros: Community hospital, non profit. Continues to work for the good of the community and workers.
cons: Need better discount in cafeteria for the workers

pros: coworkers are supportive because management is not
cons: literally the entire two year experience. left with multiple herniated discs and night terrors from the crap this hospital puts you through. they have high turn over (and could not care less about it) and make new grad nurses charge nurses because they don't have enough senior staff on shift.

pros: The intentions of MIHMC are GREAT! They provide new RNs with mentors and great training.
cons: However staffing continues to be and issue and they routinely use agency RNs making $100/hr while staff RNs are @$ 26-$30. Floor managers are rotating almost every 6 months and most specialty floors have non specialized Nurse Managers meaning all floors are run more like Med/Surg. I was in psych and routinely (almost daily) had to remind my Nurse manager of the safety concerns of our psych pts vs non psych pts. And it was routinely overlooked. Emergency response to psych (we had no crash cart or emergency equipment) was slow at best- ever during a code blue.

pros: One of the largest hospitals in the region with multiple areas of expertise and newer medical practices to gain experience as a nurse. Great teamwork with other staff.
cons: Unfortunately, the culture here is one of reactiveness instead of proactiveness when it comes to patient care. The opinions and concerns of employees fall by the wayside, the staffing is dangerous; however, the number of responsibilities that are shirked on nurses continue to grow creating an even higher level of stress. Management doesn't show much concern for employees unless it benefits or effects them in a financial or political way. Definitely reminded on a consistent basis that everyone is expendable. Good work and effort is not acknowledged or rewarded. There are no benefits for loyalty, seniority, or a job well done; however, more a constant barrage of what is not being done, or what is not being done well enough. It makes it very hard to stay here for an extended period of time and is a definite contributing factor to the nursing shortage.

review_title: No one says anything because of fear of retaliation
pros: Some great people to work with. I learned a lot from working here.
cons: Racist Supervisors against POC; Fear of retaliation was told let's keep things in house; Will make you feel less than daily; The racism I experienced here was ridiculous, "I do not need to know what crime a black person commits while I'm at work, why are you showing me this?! ( this was said twice to a supervisor!) The POC in this hospital are treated horribly someone needs to monitor each department especially ones that have NO or 1! POC!

review_title: Easy job with good benefits and relatively adequate pay comparable to competitors.

cons: Working security at a hospital makes you irrelevant to the overall objective and it’s obvious they feel this way.

job_title: Security Police Officer in Mobile, AL
pros:
Easy job in predominantly climate controlled environment

Comparable pay to local law enforcement positions

Annual merit raises most of the time
cons:
Very political environment with an organization which is healthcare based ran by corporate business men/women most of which have no concept of healthcare.

The same thing as any other public service job it can be frustrating always dealing with the problems in such an inherently confrontational position.

pros: They have very good benefits & great customer service in most departments. MIMC cares about the patients & it shows through their work.
cons: Mobile infirmary medical center do not have many opportunities for job advancement and it's hard to get a raise. The pay is average and there are no bonuses.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Mobile, AL
pros: Excellent on the job training.  Very skilled and compassionate team in Case Management.  Nice hospital and awesome patients!  Very good pay and benefits for full-time employees.
cons: Stressful environment at times.  The campus is not in the safest neighborhood. Benefits expensive for part-time employees.

review_title: I received 12 weeks of on the job training, great people and great teamwork.
pros: Teamwork if there is a problem, everybody is there to help. Great benefits. Decent pay. Great hands on experience and great place to practice skills
cons: The only con is the location it is not in the best neighborhood however,  mobile infirmary does have trained security and I have always felt safe.

review_title: Some of the best and worst times of my life
pros: Most of the people there are warm and welcoming and will be your best friend. I made so many friends while working here!
cons: The politics are horrible! You have to watch your back at all times!

pros: Benefits were good and HR training for incoming employees was good.  Starting hourly rate was 'okay'.
cons: RNs are chronically understaffed requiring high patient caseloads.  The management seems overwhelmed.  Manager of my floor seemed too busy with paperwork to offer much feedback or training. Nurses could support one another much more than they do.
